title: Jules Quentin KOUAMO @kjq
text:
I’m a PhD Student in TIMA lab, working on Architectures and Software Methods for Mixed System Testing.





CNRS - Grenoble Inp - TIMA

The thesis focuses on the integration of digital and analog testing methodologies for mixed-signal systems, which are becoming increasingly common in modern circuits. Currently, the testing methods for digital and analog components are separate and distinct, despite their close link in operation. The goal of the thesis is to develop a unified approach that bridges the technological and methodological gap between the digital and analog domains, allowing for the development of hybrid software and hardware solutions optimized for designers’ needs.

Supervisors: Emmanuel SIMEU - Michele PORTOLAN



CASYTI - CUSO

The aim of the program Techwomen Factory is to create a local digital industry that trains, empowers and employs young people and young women in particular in the areas of digital creativity for sustained, sustainable economic growth and decent jobs for all (SDG8, SDG5, SDG4 and SDG10).In the DataScience section, I taught the basics of data analysis, R programming and data analysis with R.




EARTHWORM FUNDATION CAMEROON

We worked on collecting and analyzing data from the SOSUCAM company. The aim of the study was to monitor the corporate social responsibility (CSR) introduced at SOSUCAM in 2016.






2023: Graduated from Université de Yaoundé I - Cameroon







APCO (African Public Contract Ontology) is an ontology that allows the description of public procurement terms, with a first use case in Cameroon.
Started on: July 2022 (Version 1.0)
Go to Project Go to Paper










Kouamo, J., Kouokam, E., Atemezing, G. (2024). Building and Validating an Ontology for Public Procurement: The Case of Cameroon. In: Melatagia Yonta, P., Barkaoui, K., Ndoundam, R., Yenke, O.B. (eds) Research in Computer Science. CRI 2023. Communications in Computer and Information Science, vol 2085. Springer, Cham.
➡️ DOI Link





“Ontology in Public Procurement” - Data Science School, DSS23. Dangbo, Benin, 2023.

“An Application of Generating Knowledge Graphs for Public Procurement in Cameroon” - Bi & Semantic Web Conference, BISW24. Lomé, Togo, October 2024.
➡️ Slides






2024:

Teaching Assistant, TD - BE/TP - Project, for the course “Systèmes d’exploitation et Programmation Concurrente (SEPC)” - 2nd year, Semester 7 (2AS7) at Phelma

Teaching Assistant, BE/TP, for the course “Programmation Structurée” - 1st year, Semester 5 (1AS5) at Phelma

2023:

Teaching Assistant, TD/TP, for the course “Langage formel et compilation” - Master 1 at University of Yaounde 1 UY1
Teaching Assistant, TD/TP, for the course “Base de données” - Level 3 at University of Yaounde 1 UY1

2022:

Teaching Assistant, Lecture/TD/TP, for the course “Fondements de l’analyse données” - at Caysti CASYTI
Teaching Assistant, Lecture/TD/TP, for the course “Programmation R” - at Caysti CASYTI
Teaching Assistant, Lecture/TD/TP, for the course “Analyse de données avec R” - at Caysti CASYTI






July 2024: Chief of Logistics - IEEE Region 8 Student and Young Professional Congress, R8SYP.






Tessent Scan and ATPG - v22.16
Tessent IJTAG - v22.16
Certified Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt
Environmental assessment of development policies and projects
Semantic web - Web of data




You can reach me via email for:
- Personal inquiries: kouamojulesquentin@gmail.com
- Professional matters: jules.quentin@univ-grenoble-alpes.fr
Address:
46 Avenue Félix Viallet,
38000 Grenoble, France
